alert.note: Alert for Watauga (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 11 at 11:45PM EST until November 12 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: .Several inches of rain fell across this region Thursday and Friday as the remnants of Hurricane Nicole drifted through the region. The heavy rainfall has moved north out of the area, but excessive runoff continues. The Watauga River at Sugar Grove and also the South Fork of the New River at Jefferson are currently in minor flood at this hour and are expected to remain in minor flood for the next several hours. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest North Carolina, including the following counties, Ashe and Watauga. * WHEN...Until 400 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying normally flood-prone locations is occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1134 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that from 3 to 5 with locally up to 8 inches of rain fell across the warned area during the past 24 to 36 hours. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Darnell Creek, Call Creek, Dutch Creek, Brushy Fork, Beaver Creek, Dugger Creek, Elk Creek, Cove Creek, Craborchard Creek, Beech Creek and Beaverdam Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Boone, Blowing Rock, Beech Mountain, Todd, Deep Gap, Sugar Grove and Foscoe. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
